name: The Serpent's Riddle
description: The deceiver of Eden challenges your knowledge of God's Word. Three rounds of temptation ‚Äî will you stand firm?
entranceText: The serpent rises from the shadows...
defeatText: The truth crushes the serpent's lies!

questions.scenario: The serpent tells you 'You will not surely die if you eat the fruit.'
questions.question: What does God's Word actually say about eating the forbidden fruit?

choices.text: God said you will certainly die
God said you might get sick
God said it was just a test

questions.feedback: God's Word is always true! 'You will certainly die' was the clear warning.

questions.verse: The serpent was more ___ than any wild animal the Lord God had made.
questions.feedback: The serpent was crafty ‚Äî using twisting words to confuse Eve.

questions.scenario: After eating the fruit, Adam and Eve hear God walking in the garden.
questions.question: What did Adam and Eve do when they heard God?

choices.text: They ran towards God to tell Him
They hid among the trees from God
They called out to God for forgiveness

questions.feedback: Sin always separates us from God. They hid ‚Äî but God came looking for them anyway!
Cain tried to deny responsibility. But we ARE responsible for how we treat each other!

questions.scenario: God warns Cain that sin is 'crouching at the door' before he kills Abel.
questions.question: What does God want Cain to do about his anger?

choices.text: Master it and do what is right
Express it to feel better
Blame it on God for rejecting his offering

questions.feedback: God said 'sin is crouching at the door ‚Äî you must master it.' We CAN choose right!

questions.verse: Enoch walked faithfully with God; then he was no more, because God ___ him away.
questions.feedback: Enoch's close walk with God was so complete that death itself couldn't hold him!

questions.scenario: Everyone around Noah is evil and corrupt. God asks Noah to build a massive ark.
questions.question: Noah had never seen rain. People mocked him. What should he do?

choices.text: Trust God completely and build the ark
Wait until it actually starts raining to believe
Ask for a sign before committing

questions.feedback: By faith Noah built the ark when he had not yet seen the rain. That is true faith!

questions.verse: Noah was a righteous man, ___ among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.
questions.feedback: Blameless doesn't mean perfect ‚Äî it means completely committed to God.

questions.scenario: After the flood God shows Noah a rainbow and makes a promise.
questions.question: What did God promise with the rainbow?

choices.text: To never again destroy the earth by flood
To always protect Noah's family from trouble
To make the earth perfect forever

questions.feedback: The rainbow is God's signature on a forever promise. Every rainbow reminds us God keeps His word!

name: Pharaoh's Final Test
tagline: I will NOT let your people go!
description: Egypt's mightiest king bars the exit. Answer his three rounds of challenges to free God's people.
entranceText: Pharaoh sits upon his golden throne...
defeatText: The Red Sea crashes ‚Äî Pharaoh's army is defeated!

questions.scenario: God appears to Moses in a burning bush that does not burn up.
questions.question: God tells Moses to lead Israel out of Egypt. Moses says 'Who am I to do this?' What is the best response?

choices.text: Trust God's call even when you feel unqualified
Wait until you feel ready and confident
Find someone else more qualified

questions.feedback: God said 'I will be with you.' His presence is always greater than our weakness!

questions.verse: God said to Moses, 'I AM WHO I ___.'
questions.feedback: I AM ‚Äî God's eternal name. Always present, never changing, always enough!
Moses boldly confronted the most powerful man on earth ‚Äî because God was with him!

questions.scenario: The Israelites are trapped between the Red Sea and Pharaoh's charging army. The people cry out in fear.
questions.question: Moses said 'Do not be afraid.' What did God tell Moses to do?

choices.text: Raise his staff and stretch it over the sea
Gather weapons and fight Pharaoh's army
Wait on the shore and pray for 40 days

questions.feedback: Moses raised his staff ‚Äî God split the sea! When we act in faith, God makes a way.

questions.verse: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for ___ to accomplish what is now being done.
questions.feedback: Joseph's words ‚Äî one of the most powerful truths in the Bible. God turns evil into good!

questions.scenario: In the wilderness, the Israelites have no food or water and start complaining against Moses.
questions.question: How did God respond to His hungry, thirsty people?

choices.text: God provided manna from heaven and water from rock
God left them to learn their lesson
God sent them back to Egypt

questions.feedback: God rained bread from heaven every morning. He always provides for His people!

questions.quote: As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.
questions.feedback: Joshua made a bold public declaration for his whole family. What about you?

questions.verse: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and ___. Do not be afraid.
questions.feedback: God commanded courage ‚Äî it's not just a feeling but a decision to trust God!

questions.scenario: The walls of Jericho are massive. God tells Joshua to march around them for 7 days and shout.
questions.question: This plan sounds foolish to the world. What should Joshua's soldiers do?

choices.text: Obey God's strange plan completely
Try a normal military attack first
Ask God for a more sensible plan

questions.feedback: The walls fell flat! God's plans often look foolish to the world but always work!

name: Goliath Reborn
tagline: Come here and I will feed you to the birds!
description: The giant of Gath returns with three rounds of terrifying challenges. Use your faith ‚Äî not your fear!
entranceText: The ground shakes as Goliath steps forward...
defeatText: The stone flies true ‚Äî the giant falls!

questions.scenario: Samson meets a lion on the road ‚Äî the Spirit of God comes upon him.
questions.question: Samson tears the lion apart with his bare hands. Later he finds honey in the carcass. What temptation should he resist?

choices.text: Breaking his Nazirite vow to touch the dead animal
Sharing the honey with his parents
Telling Philistines about the lion

questions.feedback: Samson touched the carcass despite his Nazirite vow ‚Äî small compromises lead to big falls.

questions.verse: The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the ___.
questions.feedback: God chose David ‚Äî the youngest, smallest brother ‚Äî because He looks at the heart!

questions.quote: Speak, Lord, for your servant is listening.
questions.feedback: Samuel listened before speaking ‚Äî the mark of a true servant of God.

questions.scenario: The entire Israelite army is terrified of Goliath. David is just a boy bringing food to his brothers.
questions.question: David wants to fight Goliath. King Saul offers his heavy armour. What should David do?

choices.text: Reject the armour and use his sling ‚Äî the tools God trained him with
Wear Saul's armour to show respect to the king
Wait for a real soldier to step forward first

questions.feedback: David used what God had trained him with ‚Äî not someone else's tools. Be yourself for God!

questions.verse: Jonathan became one in ___ with David, and he loved him as himself.
questions.feedback: Jonathan's friendship with David is one of the Bible's most beautiful ‚Äî purely selfless love.

questions.scenario: David has snuck into Saul's camp and stands over the sleeping king who wants him dead.
questions.question: David's men say 'God has delivered your enemy into your hands!' What does David do?

choices.text: Refuses to harm God's anointed king and takes only his spear
Kills Saul quietly to end the threat
Wakes Saul up and confronts him face to face

questions.feedback: David trusted God to handle his enemies. He refused to take revenge into his own hands.

questions.quote: Give me a wise and discerning heart so that I can govern your people and know the difference between right and wrong.
questions.feedback: Solomon asked for wisdom ‚Äî and God gave him that PLUS wealth and honour. Seek God first!

questions.verse: The fear of the Lord is the ___ of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
questions.feedback: True wisdom starts with respecting and obeying God ‚Äî not with cleverness or education alone.

questions.scenario: Solomon has everything ‚Äî wealth, wisdom, power. But his foreign wives lead him toward other gods.
questions.question: What should Solomon have done when his wives urged him to worship idols?

choices.text: Stayed completely loyal to God no matter the pressure
Worshipped their gods privately to keep peace at home
Allowed it because he was already so wise

questions.feedback: Even the wisest man fell when he compromised on obedience. Keep your heart fully His!

name: The False Prophet's Trial
tagline: Your God is silent. Bow to Baal!
description: Lies disguised as truth. Three rounds of fire to test what you really know.
entranceText: The false prophet steps forward with a smirk...
defeatText: Fire falls from heaven ‚Äî the truth wins!

questions.scenario: 450 prophets of Baal have failed all day. Elijah rebuilds the altar, drenches it with water, and prays.
questions.question: Elijah drenched the altar with water 3 times before calling on God. Why was this significant?

choices.text: To show that God ‚Äî not Baal ‚Äî would miraculously light the wet wood
Because water is holy and needed for prayer
To make it fair for the prophets of Baal

questions.feedback: Elijah made it IMPOSSIBLE by human means ‚Äî so when fire fell, everyone knew it was God!

questions.verse: After the fire came a gentle ___ voice. When Elijah heard it, he pulled his cloak over his face.
questions.feedback: After earthquake, wind, and fire ‚Äî God spoke in a whisper. Sometimes God is loudest when He's quiet.

questions.quote: I have been very zealous for the Lord God Almighty. I am the only one left, and now they are trying to kill me too.
questions.feedback: Elijah felt utterly alone ‚Äî but God said 7,000 others had not bowed to Baal. You're never alone!

questions.scenario: A new law says no one can pray to anyone except King Darius for 30 days. Daniel knows about the law.
questions.question: What does Daniel do?

choices.text: Continues praying to God three times a day with his window open
Prays secretly with the window closed for 30 days
Stops praying temporarily to avoid trouble

questions.feedback: Daniel didn't hide his faith or compromise it. His open prayers were an act of holy courage!

questions.verse: Who knows whether you have not come to the kingdom for such a ___ as this?
questions.feedback: Mordecai's challenge to Esther ‚Äî God places us exactly where we are needed most!

questions.scenario: Three Hebrew young men face a blazing furnace for refusing to bow to Nebuchadnezzar's golden statue.
questions.question: They said 'Our God CAN save us ‚Äî but even if He doesn't, we will NOT bow.' What does this show?

choices.text: Faith in God even without guarantee of a good outcome
Stubbornness and disrespect for the king
They knew for certain God would rescue them

questions.feedback: This is one of the Bible's greatest faith statements ‚Äî trusting God even in the fire!

questions.scenario: Jonah has been swallowed and is praying from inside the fish. God gives him a second chance.
questions.question: What should Jonah do differently this time when God sends him to Nineveh?

choices.text: Obey immediately without running away
Go but preach a softer message so they won't repent
Ask God to destroy Nineveh from a safe distance

questions.feedback: Jonah obeyed ‚Äî and the entire city of 120,000 people repented! Obedience changes nations.

questions.quote: What I have vowed I will make good. I will say, Salvation comes from the Lord.
questions.feedback: Even inside a giant fish, Jonah worshipped God! Praise can happen anywhere.

questions.verse: Naaman's servants went to Elisha and he told him to wash himself seven times in the ___ River.
questions.feedback: Naaman nearly missed his miracle because the instruction seemed too simple. Obey simple steps!

name: The Pharisee's Chamber
tagline: By what authority do you do these things?
description: The religious leaders of Jerusalem fire their hardest questions. Three rounds ‚Äî only truth can stand.
entranceText: The Pharisee unrolls his scroll with a cold stare...
defeatText: The tomb is empty ‚Äî even death cannot silence the truth!

questions.quote: Behold the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
questions.feedback: John introduced Jesus to the world with the most powerful two sentences ever spoken.

questions.verse: The angel said to Mary, 'Do not be afraid, you have found ___ with God.'
questions.feedback: Mary found favour ‚Äî not because she was perfect, but because she was willing and humble.

questions.scenario: John the Baptist is in prison because he confronted King Herod about marrying his brother's wife.
questions.question: John sends disciples to ask Jesus 'Are you the one who was to come?' What does this moment reveal?

choices.text: Even the strongest faith can have moments of doubt in dark times
John had never believed Jesus was the Messiah
John wanted Jesus to rescue him from prison

questions.feedback: Doubt in the dark doesn't erase faith in the light. God understands our hard questions!

questions.scenario: Peter is walking on the water toward Jesus. He sees the wind and waves and begins to sink.
questions.question: Jesus reaches out and catches Peter, then says 'Why did you doubt?' What lesson does this teach?

choices.text: Keep your eyes on Jesus, not on the storm around you
Never attempt anything unless you're completely certain
Miracles only work when the weather is calm

questions.feedback: Peter succeeded while looking at Jesus. He sank when he focused on the waves. Eyes on Jesus!

questions.verse: Jesus said, 'I am the ___ the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
questions.feedback: One of the most powerful I AM statements ‚Äî Jesus is THE way, not just a way.

questions.quote: You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.
questions.feedback: Peter's great confession ‚Äî the rock on which the church was built!

questions.scenario: Mary Magdalene arrives at the tomb and finds it empty. She thinks someone has stolen the body.
questions.question: Then she hears her name spoken ‚Äî 'Mary.' She recognises the voice immediately. Who is it?

choices.text: The risen Jesus
An angel guarding the tomb
Peter who arrived before her

questions.feedback: Jesus called her by name. The Good Shepherd always knows and calls His own sheep by name!

questions.verse: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: 'I have ___ the Lord!'
questions.feedback: The first words of resurrection news ‚Äî spoken by a woman others had dismissed. God loves to use the unexpected!

questions.scenario: Peter had denied Jesus three times. After the resurrection Jesus asks Peter three times 'Do you love me?'
questions.question: Why does Jesus ask three times?

choices.text: To restore Peter with the same number as his denials
Because Jesus doubted Peter's love
To show the disciples Peter was untrustworthy

questions.feedback: Three denials ‚Äî three restorations. Jesus doesn't hold our worst moments against us forever!

name: Caesar's Inquisition
tagline: Renounce your faith or face the sword!
description: The Roman Empire at its most powerful demands silence. Three rounds ‚Äî preach the truth anyway!
entranceText: The Roman guard stamps his spear on the stone floor...
defeatText: The Gospel spreads to every nation ‚Äî nothing can stop it!

questions.scenario: Stephen is on trial for his faith and the council is furious at his message.
questions.question: As stones are thrown at him, what are Stephen's final words?

choices.text: Receive my spirit Lord ‚Äî and do not hold this sin against them
God will punish you for this!
I am innocent ‚Äî let me go!

questions.feedback: Stephen died exactly as Jesus lived ‚Äî with forgiveness on his lips. Greatest of endings!

questions.verse: Barnabas was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and ___. A great number of people were brought to the Lord.
questions.feedback: Barnabas' goodness and faith attracted people to the Lord. Your character is your greatest witness!

questions.quote: I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.
questions.feedback: At the worst moment, Stephen saw the best reality ‚Äî Jesus standing up to welcome him home!

questions.scenario: Paul and Silas are in a Philippian prison, bleeding from beatings, feet in stocks.
questions.question: What do Paul and Silas do at midnight?

choices.text: Pray and sing hymns to God while the other prisoners listen
Plan their escape before the earthquake
Send word to the other Christians for help

questions.feedback: Praise in prison! Their worship caused an earthquake, opened every door, and saved the jailer's family!

questions.verse: The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul's message.
questions.feedback: Lydia's conversion was God's work ‚Äî He opened her heart. Only He can do that!

questions.scenario: Paul's ship is caught in a violent storm for two weeks. The crew has given up all hope.
questions.question: Paul stands up on the ship and says they will survive. What was his source of confidence?

choices.text: An angel of God appeared to him saying all aboard would survive
Paul was an experienced sailor who had seen many storms
The storm was weakening and Paul could see land

questions.feedback: Paul believed God's word over his circumstances. That's faith that changes the room!

questions.quote: Don't let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example in speech, conduct, love, faith, and purity.
questions.feedback: Age is never an excuse! Timothy changed cities for God while still young.

questions.verse: I can do all this through him who ___ me strength.
questions.feedback: Not 'I can do all things because I am strong' ‚Äî but 'through HIM.' God's strength, not ours!

questions.scenario: Paul is writing from prison for possibly the last time, knowing he may be executed.
questions.question: Paul writes 'To live is Christ, to die is gain.' What does this mean?

choices.text: Whether Paul lives or dies, Jesus wins ‚Äî life is for Christ, death brings him home
Paul was tired of living and wanted to die
Paul believed death was an escape from suffering

questions.feedback: One of the most powerful life-mottos ever written ‚Äî from a prison cell with chains on his wrists!
